intro: Spermacoce scortechinii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, spherical berries that contain several seeds. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
